io.lambdacube.aspecio.aspect.interceptor

Interface Advice

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AdviceAdapter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CompositeAdvice, StackedCompositeAdvice

    public interface Advice

    Advices are Aspecio's way to describe an Aspect's behavior.

    The Advice API is designed to let the Aspect programmer minimize the impact of Aspects on the execution, by allowing to specify precisely the callbacks she is interested in. To that end, the Advice API is using a mixin approach: composable interfaces for the different events in the interception lifecycle.

    Aspecio interception is split in two:

    • The Before phase, that takes place before the intercepted method call.
      There are two mixins in the Before phase:
      • The Advice.ArgumentHook mixin, that lets the Advice access the method call arguments and optionally update them before the call ;
      • and the Advice.SkipCall mixin, that lets the Advice return a value even before the method call took place, thus completely skipping it.
    • The After phase, that takes place after the intercepted method call.
      There are three mixins in the After phase:
      • The Advice.CallReturn mixin, that lets the Advice access the method's return value and optionally change them ;
      • the Advice.Catch mixin, that lets the Advice catch exceptions thrown by the method call, and optionally change them, but never completely swallow them ;
      • the Advice.Finally mixin, that lets the Advice run code that happens after the method execution in all cases.

    Advices specify the events they are interested in the Before phase by returning BeforeAction in the appropriate method.
    For an Advice, the entry point of the Interception lifecycle is its method initialAction().

    • Returning BeforeAction.PROCEED will jump straight to the intercepted method call ;
    • Returning BeforeAction.SKIP_AND_RETURN will tell Aspecio to call the Advice.SkipCall trait in the Advice mixin, so Advice.SkipCall must be implemented. The actual method of Advice.SkipCall that will be called depends on the return type of the intercepted method call. You may find that type using CallContext.method and Method.getReturnType().
    • Returning BeforeAction.REQUEST_ARGUMENTS will tell Aspecio to call Advice.ArgumentHook.visitArguments(Arguments), so Advice.ArgumentHook must be implemented. Advice.ArgumentHook.visitArguments(Arguments) may itself return a BeforeAction to give Aspecio the next Before action to execute. The accepted values are BeforeAction.PROCEED to go straight to the method call ; BeforeAction.SKIP_AND_RETURN to skip the intercepted call and return a value based on the visited arguments ; and finally BeforeAction.UPDATE_ARGUMENTS_AND_PROCEED to update the arguments passed to the method call before proceeding.

    Advices specify the events they are interested in the After phase by defining a bitmask afterPhases(). The different masks available, for each After phase, are Advice.CallReturn.PHASE, Advice.Catch.PHASE and Advice.Finally.PHASE. If an Advice requests an After phase through a mask, it must implement the corresponding phase trait.
    For instance, an Advice interested in the Advice.CallReturn and Advice.Catch phases could define afterPhases() with the following code: 

     
 public int aferPhases() {
     return CallReturn.PHASE + Catch.PHASE;
 }

    However, afterPhases() is free to return different values depending on the CallContext: the result is never cached by Aspecio.

    It is often preferable to implement AdviceAdapter rather than Advice as it makes it easier to define dynamic Advices, that is Advices that can behave differently depending on the CallContext.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Advice.ArgumentHook
      A trait to receive an intercepted method call's Arguments.
      static interface  Advice.CallReturn
      A trait to receive the intercepted method return value from Aspecio, as long as afterPhases() requests the phase Advice.CallReturn.PHASE.
      static interface  Advice.Catch
      A trait to receive the intercepted method exceptions from Aspecio, as long as afterPhases() requests the phase Advice.Catch.PHASE.
      static interface  Advice.Finally
      A trait to run code after the method call in all conditions, as long as afterPhases() requests the phase Advice.Finally.PHASE.
      static interface  Advice.SkipCall
      A trait to ask Aspecio to return early, before the intercepted call is executed.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Advice DEFAULT
      An Advice doing nothing.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int afterPhases()
      The After phases this Advice will take part in.
      default boolean hasPhase(int phase) 
      BeforeAction initialAction()
      The first action to tell Aspecio to do when this Advice intercepts a method.
